titleStmt.title: A true and impartial account of the present state of affairs in London-derry in Ireland being a relation of a great fight betwixt the Protestants and the French and Irish papists : with the number of persons slain and prisoners taken : in a letter from Captain Woosley, from on board the fleet with Major General Kirk, lying at anchor in the mouth of London-derry harbor.
titleStmt.author: Wolseley, William, 1640?-1697.

notesStmt.note: "Licensed J.F., and entered according to order."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
